body:
There is no data augmentation feature at the moment.
We definitely want to add it in the future.
Contributions are welcome.

I can look into this - @w4nderlust  any ideas on how image augmentation should be approached and integrated into ludwig?  
Edit: looks like TF has some [built-in tools](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r1.14/tensorflow/python/keras/preprocessing/image.py#L295-L519) for data augmentation

@manesioz the example you provide is useful. The problem with it is that it looks like it assumes that the inputs to your model are only images and that the outputs to your model are only categories judging from this snippet: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r1.14/tensorflow/python/keras/preprocessing/image.py#L376-L403
In Ludwig that's not the case, so if someone wants to add the same functionality in Ludwig, one would have to deal with other input features and potentially multiple output features.

@manesioz  sorry I did not mean that the data augmentation should work for all feature types, what I meant is that the example works with only one feature input, in Ludwig there could be several, so for instance if you apply 4 transformations to your image input feature, all the other input features have to be replicated 4 more times, which the example does not consider.

Just for a reference, I am very proficiently using ImgAug (https://github.com/aleju/imgaug) for image augmentation.
Has *lots* of augmentation possibilities, and correctly maps points\vectors\shapes\segmentations\etc on the destination image\array.
It takes account of any chained modifications on the image (multiple transformations do not require multiple adaptations of the other features, but are passed in one unique transformation sequence) and has many many transformations built-in (see the project homepage for a visual demo)

I agree with the fact that augmentation should not be domain agnostic... In the last 2 or 3 projects I used data augmentation on (always and only talking about images) I had to perform very different image augmentations based on the dataset I'm working on.
Some had to never have flipped or distorted images, but were highly improved by noise\sharpening\blurring\zoom\crop\etc, while others needed not to have any form of noise\sharpening\blurring and were highly improved by flipping\distorting\rotating\etc
Just think about a specific object detection in an industrial\machining environment (flipping would be a huge issue on which the piece would have to be discarded while noise is not) and about a production\textile environment (flipping a piece of fabric does absolutely nothing, distortions are already present, but noise and color noise would be disrupting in a quality control scenario)
I think it could be fine to have several options (like tokenizers for text) which could be domain specific as long as the user can decide what to use fro the model definition :)
Hi, are there any considerations / developments to introduce image augmentation for example image classification problems? Has anyone already extended ludwig in this regard?
@w4nderlust : Yes definitly an option. I'll look at the code.  Maybe it's not too much to for example to add torchvision.transforms, kornia or albumentations there.

issue.title: Add Image augmentation capability (DEPRECATED)
issue.body:
# Code Pull Requests

Add data augumentation functionality to image pipeline.

issue.title: Feature: Data Augmentation for Image Input Features
issue.body:
# Code Pull Requests

Add data augmentation capability for image input features

Addresses #490
